segments.text: I watch the woman drying that plate like it’s the only thing that matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water spilling everywhere, and it’s making me anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so focused on those cookies, completely ignoring the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, I’m surprised the stool hasn’t tipped yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so hopeful, like she’s waiting for a treasure instead of just a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to slip any second now, and it’s going to be a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is still running, and the water is just pouring out like no one cares.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long this has been going on without anyone noticing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside is so calm, but inside, it’s like a silent storm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off the faucet before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR
